source.name: Question 2
source.instructions:
WhatsApp voice call feature has two major components:
1. Call manager - responsible for initializing the call to the destined participant, to ring, and to start the conversation session once the two sides are on-line.
2. Call streamer - responsible for transmitting the recorded voice buffer between participants.

Choose the **most suitable** underlying protocol for each component:

answers.answer: The call manager relying on TCP while the streamer on UDP
The call manager relying on UDP while the streamer on TCP
